site_name: BEARIZONA WILDLIFE PARK, L L C

citations.narrative:
An approximately 100-yard section of perimeter fence west of the main gate measures 5' 9" tall at time of inspection. The
facility representative states there is a current work project to extend the perimeter fence height to meet the minimum 8
feet requirement. A perimeter fence of less than 8 feet high may not adequately protect the animals inside the facility or
be an efficient secondary containment system. Perimeter fencing for potentially dangerous animals must be of sufficient
height to protect the animals within the facility from entry of unauthorized persons and animals as well as function as a
secondary containment system for the animals in the facility. Fences less than 8 feet high for potentially dangerous
animals must be approved in writing by the Administrator.
Correct by 24 August 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
An approximately 100-yard section of perimeter fence west of the main gate measures 5' 9" tall at time of inspection. The 
facility representative states there is a current work project to extend the perimeter fence height to meet the minimum 8 
feet requirement. A perimeter fence of less than 8 feet high may not adequately protect the animals inside the facility or 
be an efficient secondary containment system. Perimeter fencing for potentially dangerous animals must be of sufficient 
height to protect the animals within the facility from entry of unauthorized persons and animals as well as function as a 
secondary containment system for the animals in the facility. Fences less than 8 feet high for potentially dangerous 
animals must be approved in writing by the Administrator. 
 
Correct by 24 August 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
